keyMoments.title: Decides to Help the Straw Hats
keyMoments.description: Despite his failing health and advanced age, Zenny makes the bold decision to help the Straw Hat Pirates escape the Marine trap by using his ship.
keyMoments.significance: Showcases Zenny's courage and his growing bond with the Straw Hats.
keyMoments.quote: I may be old, but I can still help my pirate friends!

keyMoments.title: Officially Declares Himself a Pirate
keyMoments.description: As his ship reaches the ocean, Zenny officially declares that he has become a pirate, fulfilling a lifelong dream despite his age and illness.
keyMoments.significance: The culmination of Zenny's character arc, reinforcing the theme that it's never too late to pursue your dreams.
keyMoments.quote: I'm at sea now! I've officially become a pirate!

keyMoments.title: Reveals the Truth About His Treasure
keyMoments.description: Zenny reveals that his supposed treasure was cash that the goats ate, and now he considers the goats themselves his true treasure.
keyMoments.significance: Reframes the entire arc and reinforces One Piece's theme that friendship is more valuable than material wealth.
keyMoments.quote: The goats ate all my cash when I was unconscious. They're my treasure now - they saved my life and gave me companionship.

keyMoments.title: Resolves to Pursue His Pirate Dream
keyMoments.description: Despite his age and heart condition, Zenny declares he will continue pursuing his dream of adventure and piracy for as long as he's able.
keyMoments.significance: Final character moment embodying One Piece's core message that dreams are worth pursuing regardless of circumstances.
keyMoments.quote: My age won't stop me from becoming a pirate. I'll go on adventures for as long as I'm able!

relationships.description: Zenny befriends the Straw Hat Pirates and is inspired by their dedication to their dreams.

evolutionMoments.description: Zenny risks his life to help the Straw Hats escape the Marine trap.

reveals.information: His treasure was eaten by goats, who he now considers his true treasure
Despite being elderly with a heart condition, he refuses to give up on his dreams

keyMoments.title: Reveals His True Intentions
keyMoments.description: Minchey reveals his plan to steal Zenny's treasure and admits to paying off his subordinate Marines to help with his personal schemes.
keyMoments.significance: Exposes Minchey as the true antagonist and reveals corruption within the Marine forces.
keyMoments.quote: I've been paying off my men so they'd help me steal your treasure, old man!

keyMoments.title: Attacks Zenny
keyMoments.description: Minchey physically attacks the elderly Zenny, kicking him and demanding the location of his treasure.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates Minchey's villainy and lack of honor.
keyMoments.quote: Tell me where the treasure is, or you won't live to see another day!

keyMoments.title: Defeated by Goats
keyMoments.description: Following Robin's intervention, Zenny's loyal goats charge and trample Minchey, helping to defeat him.
keyMoments.significance: Provides poetic justice as the goats defeat the man seeking material wealth.

relationships.description: Minchey served under Captain Moore before being stripped of his rank for corruption.

evolutionMoments.description: Moore discovers Minchey's corruption and strips him of his rank.

relationships.description: Minchey attempts to steal Zenny's treasure and attacks him.

evolutionMoments.description: Minchey reveals his plan and attacks Zenny before being defeated.

reveals.information: Corrupt Marine officer who bribes subordinates for personal gain

keyMoments.title: Strips Minchey of His Rank
keyMoments.description: Captain Moore physically strips Minchey of his rank by tearing off his epaulets and condemns him as a disgrace to the Marines.
keyMoments.significance: Shows that there are honorable Marines who uphold justice even within a flawed system.
keyMoments.quote: You're a disgrace to the Marines! I hereby strip you of your rank!

keyMoments.title: Lets the Straw Hats Go
keyMoments.description: Captain Moore tells Luffy that he has no interest in capturing Zenny or pursuing the Straw Hats, giving them a free pass to leave.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates Moore's sense of honor and justice, showing the complex morality in One Piece.
keyMoments.quote: I have no interest in capturing Zenny. You're free to go.

relationships.description: Moore was Minchey's commanding officer before stripping him of rank.

evolutionMoments.description: Moore punishes Minchey for corruption by stripping him of his rank.

relationships.description: Moore shows respect to the Straw Hats by letting them go after they helped expose Minchey's corruption.

evolutionMoments.description: Moore chooses not to pursue the Straw Hats, showing respect for their role in exposing corruption.

reveals.information: Honorable Marine captain who values justice over blind enforcement

keyMoments.title: Saves Zenny with Abacus Throw
keyMoments.description: Robin intervenes by throwing an abacus at Minchey, disrupting his attack on Zenny and saving the old man's life.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Robin's resourcefulness and her integration with the crew as she protects someone they befriended.

name.japanese: トニートニー・チョッパー

keyMoments.title: Treats Zenny's Injuries
keyMoments.description: Chopper immediately rushes to provide medical treatment for Zenny's injuries and heart condition when the Going Merry reaches him.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates Chopper's dedication as a doctor and the Straw Hats' loyalty to those they consider friends.
